page.title: 13BIRDS AROUND WADEBRIDGE
page.content: Wadebridge has a wide variety of habitat including{woodland}in{ {Coronation Park, tidal estuary of the {River Camel}and{open grassland}.Birds observed this year include :buzzard, blackcap, barn owl, cormorant, coot, coal tit, firecrest, garden warbler, sedge warbler, heron, kingfisher, moorhen, sand martin, spotted and pied flycatchers, spotted and green woodpeckers, tawney owl, white fronted geese, peregrine falcon, water rail, mute swan, swift, and marsh tit. Most of these birds breed in the area but there are many migrant birds that visit in winter. On the islands in the river by the bridge the cubs and scouts have built sites to encourage the mute swans to nest so that people may see them. This year the second clutch of eggs hatched but the cygnets did not survive.
